value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. Combined with the Power BI template report, you can gain a lot of insights into usage of your datasets. With more to come down the road!  Announcing long-term usage

value.title: Using Power BI reports from an end user perspective (2021)
value.excerpt: Just an end user of Power BI? Consuming reports and not authoring at all? Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports. Jump in and get familiar with reports in Power BI!  Reports in Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/end-user-reports  View a report in the Power BI service

value.title: How to Create Power BI Account without a Work Email 📧 (Use Gmail/Outlook/Hotmail)
value.excerpt: Have you tried creating a PowerBI.com account online but got stuck because you did not have a Work Email? value.title: Power BI Apps and App Workspaces: How to distribute Power BI content to a Large Audience
value.excerpt: Power BI Apps are a terrific way to distribute your Power BI content to a large audience.  You can "Publish App" to Entire Organization or specific individuals and groups. Then any user (within the Group you provided Access to) can click "Get Apps" to consume your App - which comprises the Dashboards,

value.title: Basic Sharing, and Manage Permissions in Power BI Simple, but Useful
value.excerpt: Power BI provides multiple ways of sharing content with users. Each sharing method has pros and cons and can be used for specific scenarios. Some of the sharing methods can be used together to build a framework for sharing. In this post, I will talk about the most basic way of sharing Power BI content.

value.excerpt: Combining multiple files from one folder is already supported built-in through the graphical interface of Power Query when use you Get Data from Folder. value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. value.title: Extract Parts of a Text Value in Power BI using a Delimiter Power Query Transformation
value.excerpt: If you have a text field and you want to extract a part of that text field, there are multiple ways to do that. You can do this using the SUBSTRING function in DAX. However, These types of actions are better to be done using Power Query transformations. Fortunately, Power Query is very easy and simple

value.title: Power BI Pattern   Find Start and End Date of Task from Children
value.excerpt: The project and task planning management systems have the concept of each task starting and ending with a date.
